item.title: Lab 2: Simple Linear Regression
item.description: library(psych) #describe() library(PerformanceAnalytics) #chart.correlation() library(lm.beta) #lm.beta() library(sjPlot) #tab_model() library(gridExtra) #grid.arrange() library(tidyverse) This lab will be an overview of simple linear regression and was created along side Karen’s lectures and her code. Simple Linear Regression The Equation The equation of simple linear regression is this: $$Y_i = \alpha + \beta{x}_i + \epsilon_i $$ Expressed as Betas: $$ Y_i = \beta_0 + \beta{x}_i + \epsilon_i $$ When we are predicting Y, we express the prediction equation as this:
